job_title: Grounds Assistant in Kansas City, MO
pros: Great environment, co-workers, and flexibility.
cons: Nothing bad to say, recommended

job_title: Financial Services in Kansas City, MO
pros: -The hours are not too bad (8:00 - 4:30) - It's easy to take days off if needed and possible to work from home on some days. -You get your own office -Its a great university with a great history.
cons: -The pay is very low. -The days can go by very slow and can be boring at times. -There are not many office outings or morale building activities. -The system they use is very complicated and makes mistakes often.

job_title: Advancement Associate in Kansas City, MO
pros: Jesuit core values. Value of educational experience.
cons: Salary is not on par with market

job_title: Graduate Student in Kansas City, MO
pros: Get DPT degree within 2.5 years
cons: Hybrid formatting during height of COVID

job_title: Assistant Professor in Kansas City, MO
pros: The people and environment there are wonderful. They're under-resourced though.
cons: Lack of access to modern University amenities and salary.

job_title: Assistant Director of Career Development in Kansas City, KS
pros:
- Sense of community
- So much involvement and extra curricular involvement
- Education perks
- Care for the person
cons: - Lower pay in comparison to other places

review_title: Do You Have a Passion for Higher Ed?
job_title: Admissions Counselor in Kansas City, MO
pros:
- Fantastic Culture
- Meaningful Work
- Master's Degree Paid For
- Friends that last a lifetime
- Strong Work/Life Balance
cons:
- Low Pay
- No opportunity for growth (Have to be at the right place at the right time) 
- Lack of raises

job_title: Assistant Professor in Kansas City, MO
pros: Decent benefits. Kept our salaries upon merger. Well respected university. Tuition remission for dependents.
cons: To me personally, this place is way over the top with liberal ideals and pushes a social justice agenda.. If that's the way you roll you'll love it!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kansas City, MO
pros: I really feel like the people I work with care about me and my wellbeing and really want to get to know me.
cons: I really can't think of any cons to add here.

job_title: Financial Aid Counsleor in Kansas City, MO
pros: Great people, good work-life balance, generous tuition assistance program
cons: The pay is pretty low.

job_title: Admissions Counselor in Kansas City, MO
pros: Flexible travel schedule, friendly environment
cons: Below average pay, low chance of promotion

job_title: College Coach in Kansas City, MO
pros: Great kids to work with, excellent location and campus. Athletic staff is terrific.
cons: Pay is far below living wage. Complete disconnect with university administration. Administration does not value athletics, zero support.

job_title: Work Study in Kansas City, MO
pros: Chill job that works around student schedule
cons: Not super exciting or growth potential

review_title: Great students, poor leadership, terrible pay with relentless work
job_title: Faculty in Kansas City, MO
pros: Nice people, most “quit but stay” out of complete frustration
cons: Eliminated retirement benefits. Salary WAY below average.

job_title: Programmer Analyst in Kansas City, MO
pros: comfort benefits pay vacation office
cons: work work work work work

job_title: Associate Professor in Kansas City, MO
pros: This is a good place.
cons: Same issues as any university.

job_title: Library Director in Kansas City, MO
pros: Employer values employees and demonstrates care.
cons: I can't think of anything negative to say about this employer.

job_title: Director of Music in Kansas City, MO
pros: Great faculty colleagues, a lot of good support and energy at the faculty level.  Pleasant campus.
cons: Bullying atmosphere from Arts & Sciences admin, lack of concern and responsiveness to faculty needs, confused priorities for the college moving forward, poor salary, will not hire with tenure, unwillingness to accommodate, or even attempt to understand, "hidden" disabilities.

review_title: Great Place to work if you aren't motivated by money.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kansas City, MO
pros: In general, the management is fantastic, very supportive and collaborative. The benefits are quite good as well with better 403b matching than many other companies.
cons:
It's a non-profit, so the salaries are well below industry standard for the work you're doing in most cases. While you are being underpaid you can also expect to be charged for parking, and constantly hassled to donate part of your meager earnings back to the school. 

Tight budgets make it extremely difficult to work effectively. You are always pressured to find a 'free' solution to any problem.

review_title: Tense, strained, and unhappy atmosphere at the library
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kansas City, MO
pros:
Compensation for a part time job was above average.
Most of the staff members were friendly and kind.
cons: One employee in particular created a hostile, tense, and uncomfortable atmosphere that prevented collaboration and collegiality. The library worked in an extremely hierarchical way due to the demands of one staff member who regularly bullied other staff members at and below her level. This was felt by myself even as a part time employee. The atmosphere always felt tense during my day shifts and there was an aura of fear.

review_title: I loved working at the Greenlease Library!
job_title: Public Services Assistant in Kansas City, MO
pros: The people are the top reasons to love your job. The students, the co-workers, the faculty, the administration. Very kind. Lots of time off at Christmas that is paid! The Library Director Laurie is one of the kindest human beings I've ever known.
cons: Pay was low, not a lot of growth potential.

review_title: An incredible place to work and learn
job_title: Director of Marketing in Kansas City, MO
pros: The community sets Rockhurst apart from everyone else. A place where everyone cares for one another, and helps each other and the university reach its goals.
cons: It's a smaller institutions, so resources are limited, but we always find a way!

review_title: Tension among the staff and poor organization and mentoring by the supervisors
job_title: Librarian in Kansas City, MO
pros: The hours are standard for the profession.
cons: Micromanagement by the library administration.  Unlike most academic libraries, the atmosphere is non-collegial.  Supervisors are either unable or unwilling to mentor staff and other librarians.  Suggestions or innovative ideas by staff and other librarians are not welcome.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kansas City, MO
pros: Great Connections, Great experience. Very Flexible Hours

review_title: Most staff work here for the free tuition benefit
